name: NCWidgetListViewController
desc: An object that provides a list view for displaying content in a macOS Today widget.DeprecatedUse WidgetKit instead.

items.name: var delegate: NCWidgetListViewDelegate?
items.desc: The list view controller’s delegate or nil if the receiver doesn’t have a delegate.

items.name: protocol NCWidgetListViewDelegate
items.desc: The interface for handling content display and editing in the list view of a macOS Today widget.

items.name: var contents: [Any]
items.desc: An array of objects to display in the list view.

items.name: func row(for: NSViewController) -> Int
items.desc: Returns the row represented by the specified content view controller.

items.name: func viewController(atRow: Int, makeIfNecessary: Bool) -> NSViewController
items.desc: Returns the content view controller associated with the specified row, or a new content view controller if desired.

items.name: var minimumVisibleRowCount: Int
items.desc: The minimum number of visible rows to display.

items.name: var hasDividerLines: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether list displays divider lines between rows.

items.name: var editing: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the list is in editing mode.

items.name: var showsAddButtonWhenEditing: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether an Add (+) button is displayed while the list is in editing mode.
